channel.title: Engadget
channel.description: Engadget is a web magazine with obsessive daily coverage of everything new in gadgets and consumer electronics
channel.copyright: Copyright (c) 2021 Yahoo! Inc. All rights reserved

item.title: Samsung's 512GB DDR5 module is a showcase for the future of RAM
item.description: Samsung has unveiled a new RAM module that shows the potential of DDR5 memory in terms of speed and capacity.

item.title: Twitter surveys users about Facebook-style emoji reactions
item.description: Some Twitter users are getting surveys asking them to pick between several different emoji reaction sets.

item.title: 'FFVIII Remastered' arrives for $17 on Android and iOS
item.description: Now you can play the HD edition of 'Final Fantasy VIII' on your iOS or Android device.

item.title: Dodge's 2FA security update for muscle cars will slow thieves to a crawl
item.description: A security PIN for Dodge's performance vehicles stops anyone else from speeding away -- even if they have a key.

item.title: Playdate's mirror app links the handheld to a PC for streaming and control
item.description: When Panic's Playdate portable console ships, you'll be able to plug it into a PC to mirror the screen for streaming, or control it from the computer.

item.title: Valve's Steam Game Festival is now the Steam Next Fest
item.description: Valve's Steam Next Fest will start on June 16th.

item.title: Report links most vaccine misinformation online to just 12 people
item.description: Twelve of the most prominent anti-vaccine activists are responsible for a disproportionate amount of anti-vaccine misinformation on social media, a new report says.

item.title: Facebook caught a Chinese hacker group targeting Uyghur activists
item.description: The Evil Eye collective went after about 500 individuals, many of whom were activists, journalists and dissidents living abroad.

item.title: Dyson’s V15 Detect vacuum hunts dust with a laser 'blade'
item.description: There's also a bigger stick vacuum for bigger messes and a new Omni-glide model for smaller living spaces.

item.title: Microsoft starts testing free multiplayer for free-to-play games
item.description: The company has now started testing a dashboard update that enables removes the Xbox Live Gold requirement to play free-to-play games online.

item.title: Slack tweaks its new DM feature after people call out its harassment potential
item.description: The company is now disabling the option to send someone a message with an invite to chat after several individuals how easy it was to abuse that functionality.

item.title: The upcoming 'Among Us' account system is mostly about making the game safer
item.description: Innersloth plans to add a friends system and cross-platform cosmetics later.

item.title: 'Rocket League Sideswipe' is coming to iOS and Android
item.description: Psyonix hopes to bring 'Rocket League Sideswipe' to iOS and Android later this year.

item.title: Mark Zuckerberg proposes a 'thoughtful reform' of Section 230
item.description: He said platforms should have to prove they have systems in place to identify and remove unlawful content.

item.title: Researchers say they've made smart clothes that actually feel like fabric
item.description: Researchers say they've made smart clothes that can track poses, pressure and more — all the while remaining as comfy as everyday clothes.

item.title: Grab a subscription to Disney+ while it's still $70 a year
item.description: Save $10 by snagging a yearly subscription to Disney+ before a price increase on Friday, March 26th.

item.title: T-Mobile opens up its weekly perks to prepaid Metro customers
item.description: The latest T-Mobile Tuesdays freebie is a year-long subscription to MLB.TV.

item.title: LG's 2021 OLED TV lineup starts at $1,299
item.description: LG has unveiled pricing for its 2021 OLED TV lineup, and it starts at $1,299 for the A1. Expect to pay considerably more for the C1 and G1, though.

item.title: Researchers developed an AI backpack system to guide vision-impaired wearers
item.description: The system uses a 4K spatial camera and Intel tech for image processing.

item.title: These EarFun noise-canceling earbuds are on sale for over 25 percent off
item.description: The EarFun Free Pro delivers great sound, drowns out ambient noise and fits securely in your ears.

item.title: Slack Connect now lets you DM people outside your work bubble
item.description: Slack has unveiled a Connect feature that lets you DM virtually anyone, even if they're outside your company — helpful in the work-from-home era.

item.title: A strong Intel is what the tech industry needs right now
item.description: Intel can now show that it has a plan. It hasn’t chosen the easiest route, but it’s one that, if executed properly, can lead it back to the top. And its vision will most likely be welcomed — let’s hope it can actually follow through.

item.title: How to make your podcast stand out from the crowd
item.description: You have all the gear and a great idea. Now what? Four industry experts weigh in with their pro tips on how to turn your podcast into a career.

item.title: Sonos now has a 24-bit music streaming option
item.description: Qobuz is the first service to offer that level of audio streaming quality through Sonos speakers.

item.title: VTech’s latest instant camera for kids prints photos for only a penny
item.description: VTech's upcoming $75 instant camera for kids will only cost you a penny per printed photo, and it comes out this summer.
